Description:
Our first speaker, Dr. Nathan P. Coussens, Molecular Pharmacology Laboratories at the Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research, describes how they are leveraging patient-derived cell lines and organoids from the National Cancer Institute’s Patient-Derived Models Repository (https://pdmr.cancer.gov) as in vitro models of solid tumors for the evaluation of approved and investigational anticancer agents. 

Our second speaker, Dr. Kanya Rajangam, Senti Bioscience, describes how they have developed an off-the-shelf CAR-NK therapy for the treatment of patients with hematologic malignancies such as AML using logic gated gene circuits.
SearchResultBody: ESP05C. Transforming Productivity in Compound Profiling and Allogeneic Cell Therapy Development
Title: Transforming Productivity in Compound Profiling and Allogeneic Cell Therapy Development
